articles.summary:
Think you understand magnets? Scientists have realised over the past century
that, despite what we thought we knew, magnetism is nothing but quantum
mechanics.
articles.title: FEATURE: WATCH: Magnetism only exists because of quantum mechanics (Science Alert)

articles.summary:
On Sunday, I posted satellite images of massive fire clouds billowing from
wildfires raging along the California-Oregon border. On Tuesday, NASA's Earth
Observatory weighed in with more details, as well as spectacular photographs
taken on the evening of July 31 by James Haseltine from an Oregon Air National
Guard F-15C fighter jet — including the one above. And this one too: Rising
air currents over wildfires can carry water vapor high into the atmosphere,
causing it to cool and
articles.title: Giant Fire Clouds Over California (Discover Magazine)

articles.author: Elizabeth Howell
articles.summary:
We often speak of the discoveries and data flowing from astronomical
observatories, which makes it easy to forget the cool factor. Think of it --
huge telescopes are probing the universe under crystal-clear skies, because
astronomers need the dark skies to get their work done. That's what makes this
astronomical video by Jan Hattenbach such […]
articles.title: Glowing Galaxies Shine Above Trance-Like Telescopic Timelapse (Universe Today)

three surveillance satellites to track objects in space as part of its fiscal
2016 budget request, a top Air Force general said Tuesday.
